result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernette Denise Wallace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample, must report to Marinette County Jail to provide sample before leaving town today.
DNA surcharge paid from bond.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No contact with C.M.

Undergo any assessments, treatments and counseling as recommended by agent.
Provide truthful testimony in proceedings against C.M.

timeConds.notes:
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
May serve in any county in Wisconsin.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Court imposes:
Imposed and stayed: 18 months initial confinement, 24 months extended supervision. Not eligible for CIP and SAP.
2 years probation with conditions
Pay costs, fees, and DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample- must go to jail to give sample before leaving town today
Undergo any assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent
No contact with C.M
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription
120 days jail with huber release-may serve in any county in WI. Must report by 9-22-15 by 7pm. Credit for 14 days.
